meanings.definition: A group of endogenous opioid peptides that are derived from the precursor protein prodynorphin.
meanings.sent1: The dynorphins play a role in regulating pain signals in the body.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the effects of dynorphins on the brain's response to pain.
meanings.sent3: The dynorphins decided to throw a party in the brain to celebrate their pain-relieving abilities.
meanings.sent4: Her brain felt like a dance floor where dynorphins were the DJs, controlling the pain tunes.
meanings.sent5: Imagine tiny dynorphins as superheroes fighting off pain villains in your body.

meanings.definition: Dynorphins are involved in pain modulation and stress response in the central nervous system.
meanings.sent1: When the dynorphins are released, they help reduce the feeling of pain in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching how dynorphins can impact stress levels in patients.
meanings.sent3: The dynorphins organized a stress-relief workshop for the brain cells.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a battlefield where dynorphins fought stress monsters to protect her.
meanings.sent5: Picture dynorphins as tiny firefighters rushing to put out the flames of stress in your brain.
